title: Sensex hits all-time high: Will the dream run continue?
body: Benchmark index S&P BSE Sensexhit an all-time high during intraday trade on Wednesday, surpassing the previous peak it achieved in 2022. In December 2022, the Sensex achieved its previous all-time high of 63,583.07. The 30-share index rose over 260 points to hit a fresh all-time high of 63,588.31 in early trade but fell shortly after due to selling pressure. The NSE Nifty 50 is also eyeing a fresh record and was roughly 30 points away from achieving the milestone at around 1:40 pm. So, what's driving the bull run on Dalal Street? Both benchmark indices have been gaining over the past few months, driven by a host of macroeconomic factors such as lower inflation and stronger growth projections. Persistent foreign inflows have also been a key factor in boosting the domestic benchmark indices. It may be noted that foreign investors have put in over 73 lakh crore so far this financial year. Compared to this, foreign institutional investors were net sellers in the two previous financial years. V.L.A. Ambala (SEBI Registered Research Analyst), Stock Market Today (SMT), said, "It is another record day in India's stock market. As we had said yesterday, the price was getting ready for a new all-time high, and today Sensex has made a new all-time high of 63,588.31." "We are still in a bull run and the trend is very steep. Fundamentally strong and financially stable stocks are seeing an increase in their volumes," she added. Meanwhile, Gaurav Dua, senior vice president and head of capital market strategy at Sharekhan, told news agency Reuters that the Indian economy is in a multi-year upcycle, which is a major positive. "While there are pockets of overvaluation, pockets of opportunity also exist in markets," said Dua. "The indexes may be at or near record highs, but the valuations are not, thanks to healthy earnings growth over the past 20 months," he added. One of the key reasons behind the bull run can be attributed to a sharp acceleration in India's economic growth in the March quarter, in addition to a sharp drop in inflation. With this, the country remains on track to be the fastest-growing economy in the world. Analysts said that the fundamentals of the domestic stocks remain strong, but it is better to wait and watch as upcoming events could provide cues for the future. "I must say just wait and watch for some time. Right now, I do not see any reason to sell the price except that we are near to an all-time high, so hold it until there is no signal of profit booking," Ambala said. "To be more specific, 62,000 is a strong support level for this bullish movement and if the price sustains at the current range, we will be proudly witnessing Sensex trade in the 65,000 to 75,000 range in this financial year," she added. "Keep in mind that as an economy, we are attracting global interest, and that is a positive side for us," she added. Also Read |Dalal Street eyes key milestone after cautious opening
gnews_title: Sensex hits all-time high: Will the dream run continue? - India Today

title: Indian shares extend rally, end at fresh highs on financials boost
body: People walk past the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) building in Mumbai, India, March 9, 2020. REUTERS/Francis Mascarenhas/File Photo Purchase Licensing Rights , opens new tab BENGALURU, July 3 (Reuters) - India's blue chip indexes Nifty 50 and Sensex ended at fresh highs for the third consecutive session on Monday, aided by broad sectoral gains, with financial services in the lead. The Nifty (.NSEI) , opens new tab rose 0.70% to 19,322.55, while the S&P BSE Sensex (.BSESN) , opens new tab gained 0.75% to close above 65,000 for the first time. Both indexes hit fresh record highs earlier in the session. Make sense of global markets with the Trading Day newsletter. Sign up here. Reuters Graphics Financial services stocks (.NIFTYFIN) , opens new tab were among the top gainers on Nifty's sectoral indexes, rising 1%. Index heavyweights HDFC (HDFC.NS) , opens new tab and HDFC Bank (HDBK.NS) , opens new tab gained 1.75% and 1.08%, respectively, after approving July 1 as the effective date of their $40 billion merger. Several brokerages, including Haitong International, Nomura, and Macquarie expected further pick-up in credit growth and improvement in asset quality for financials in the June quarter. Banks (.NSEBANK) , opens new tab hit a record high for the second consecutive session, while public sector banks (.NIFTYPSU) , opens new tab rose 3.61% and were the top sectoral gainers. The rally extended to broader markets as well, with smallcaps (.NIFSMCP100) , opens new tab and midcaps (.NIFMDCP100) , opens new tab settling at an over 1-year high and a new closing high, respectively. Advertisement Â· Scroll to continue Analysts cited foreign inflows, steady earnings, monsoon revival and positive impact of HDFC merger as major triggers for the recent rise in domestic equities. However, they cautioned investors to remain patient despite the sharp rise in benchmarks, citing lack of valuation comfort. "Valuation comfort is only in out-of-favour sectors and fresh positions will need to be built in these sectors," said Amit Kumar Gupta, founder and chief investment officer at Fintrekk Capital. Advertisement Â· Scroll to continue Among individual stocks, Reliance Industries (RELI.NS) , opens new tab rose over 2.5% to a six-month high after commencing production from third deepwater field in Krishna-Godavari D6 block, in collaboration with a local unit of British oil company BP (BP.L) , opens new tab . Meanwhile, Mahindra and Mahindra (MAHM.NS) , opens new tab and UltraTech Cement (ULTC.NS) , opens new tab hit record highs, after reporting strong monthly and quarterly sales growth, respectively. Advertisement Â· Scroll to continue ($1 = 82.0355 Indian rupees) Reporting by Bharath Rajeswaran in Bengaluru; Editing by Nivedita Bhattacharjee and Varun H K Our Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles. , opens new tab Share X Facebook Linkedin Email Link Purchase Licensing Rights Read Next 1 hour ago Asian Markets category Sriwijaya Capital raises over $200 million for debut fund, eyes $300 million cap, sources say 2 hours ago Asian Markets category Kumpulan Wang Persaraan targets 30% private market allocation in 5 years 7 mins ago Wealth category Asia draws $100 billion in capital as investors diversify beyond US, Goldman executive says 5 hours ago India category India's September manufacturing growth cools as price rises soar to 12-year high, PMI shows 1 hour ago Business category Oil pauses as markets assess OPEC+ plans, demand concerns 5 hours ago VIEW India central bank keeps repo rate steady as widely expected
gnews_title: Indian shares extend rally, end at fresh highs on financials boost - Reuters
